business.headline: Sensex, Nifty end flat; heavyweight financials gain The S&P BSE Sensex closed 4.40 points lower to end at 82,555.44, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 1.15 points to close at 25,279.85.

Aadhaar Housing Finance shares jump over 8%. What should investors do? Aadhaar Housing Finance shares have gained sharply, rising more than 6% in intraday trade. Read on to know the factors driving the surge and what it means for investors.

Bajaj Housing Finance IPO: Check price band, issue size, dates and GMPThe price band for Bajaj Housing Finance IPO is set between Rs 66 and Rs 70 per share. Retail investors must apply for a minimum of 214 shares, requiring a minimum investment of Rs 14,980.
World Bank upgrades India's FY25 GDP forecast to 7%Looking ahead, the World Bank expects India's medium-term outlook to remain positive, with strong growth projected for FY26 and FY27.

HAL shares soar as Cabinet clears Rs 26,000 crore order. Check target priceThe order is expected to boost HAL's order backlog from Rs 94,000 crore to Rs 1.2 lakh crore, providing strong revenue visibility, according to a report by Antique Stock Broking.

Raymond Group plans IPO listings for apparel, real estate units by 2025: ReportRaymond Group IPOs: Chairman Gautam Singhania recently explained that the restructuring is intended to address what he described as "subdued valuations" due to the varied nature of Raymond's portfolio.

GST panel recommends tax relief for foreign airlinesThis proposal follows extensive deliberations by the fitment committee and could offer substantial relief to foreign airlines currently facing tax demands from the Directorate General of GST Intelligence (DGGI).

Can Reko Diq's gold mine end Pakistan's economic crisis? Reko Diq is one of the world's largest undeveloped copper and gold reserves, with the potential to produce 200,000 tons of copper and 250,000 ounces of gold annually for over half a century.

Gold, silver price today, September 3, 2024: Precious metals witness dip on MCXGold Price Today September 3, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the lower side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Tuesday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

No salary paid to Madhabi Buch after retirement: ICICI Bank on Congress's claimMadhabi Buch served as the CEO of ICICI Securities from February 2009 to May 2011. In a statement, the bank said it has not paid any salary or granted any ESOPs to Buch after her retirement, other than her retiral benefits.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: 'IC 814' row: Netflix adds real names of hijackers to opening disclaimerIn an official statement released on September 3, Netflix Content Head, Monika Shergill, announced that the real names of the terrorists have been added to the opening disclaimer of 'IC 814: The Kandahar Hijack'.

How can retirement benefits exceed salary? Congress's fresh charge at Sebi chiefCongress leader Pawan Khera claimed that Madhabi Buch's average annual salary at ICICI was Rs 1.30 crore. However, he questioned how her average pension and other retiral benefits turned out to be Rs 2.77 crore.

Bengal anti-rape bill passed amid 'Mamata Banerjee vs BJP' fireworks in assemblyAfter a brief discussion, the West Bengal Assembly passed the anti-rape 'Aparajita' bill which provides for the death penalty for rape and sexual offences for persons convicted of rape if their actions result in the victim's death or leave her in a vegetative state.

The 'richie rich' Sultan of Brunei who hosts PM Modi in largest palace todayBrunei, strategically located on the island of Borneo, is smaller than Indian states like Sikkim and Tripura, but its Sultan's immense wealth and lavish lifestyle has repeatedly grabbed attention.
Why Indians of all ages are logging out of the rat race to take up slow livingThe subtle art of doing nothing is gaining more attention, even in India, as people try to escape their fast-paced lives.
Sandip Ghosh, ex-principal of RG Kar hospital, sent to 8-day CBI custodySandip Ghosh, ex-principal of Kolkata's RG Kar hospital, remanded to CBI custody for 8 days

Congress faces alliance dilemma in Haryana as AAP demands 20 seats: SourcesAs the Haryana Assembly elections near, the Congress party is facing tough alliance negotiations, particularly with AAP, which is demanding around 20 seats, according to sources.

PM Modi arrives in Brunei, commences two-nation visit, next stop SingaporePM Modi's visit to Brunei is the first-ever by an Indian head of state, despite 40 years of diplomatic ties between the two nations.

Watch: YouTuber IShowSpeed's new robot dog worth Rs 84 lakh shoots flames at himAmerican YouTuber IShowSpeed shared a review of his robot dog that he bought from China. The video has gone viral for all the wrong reasons.

Sathyabama welcomes the Yorker Champion Jasprit BumrahIn a memorable event, Sathyabama University had the honour of hosting one of India's most celebrated cricket icons, Mr. Jasprit Bumrah. The university's President, Dr. Marie Johnson, and Chancellor, Dr. Mariazeena Johnson, warmly welcomed the champion fast bowler, renowned for his impeccable yorkers, to the campus.

The atmosphere was electric as students gathered in large numbers, eager to catch a glimpse of the cricket sensation. Their excitement and enthusiasm were palpable, reflecting the immense respect and admiration they hold for Bumrah. His visit not only inspired the students but also created an unforgettable experience, further strengthening the bond between sports and academia at Sathyabama University.

Kamala Harris trolled for 'fake accent', compared to Looney Tunes characterUS Vice President Kamala Harris faced criticism for allegedly adopting a "fake accent" during a Labour Day rally in Detroit, Michigan. As she addressed union workers, her altered tone sparked controversy, leading to heavy trolling from Trump supporters. Some compared her accent to Foghorn Leghorn, a Looney Tunes character.

ICC announces WTC final 2025 dates, Lord's to host epic clash for first timeThe International Cricket Council (ICC) announced the dates for the World Test Championship (WTC) final 2025. The epic clash is set to be hosted at Lord's from June 11.

In IC 814 Kandahar hijack, the mystery of black briefcase and two red bagsThough much has been written about the hijacking of Indian Airlines flight IC 814, there are several aspects of the 1999 Kandahar hijack that remain shrouded in mystery, especially the two red bags and a black briefcase that played a crucial role in the incident. What were in the briefcase and the bags?

Bangladesh script history, complete 2-0 Test series sweep in PakistanBangladesh beat Pakistan by 6 wickets in the second Test at Rawalpindi Cricket Stadium in Rawalpindi to script a historic maiden Test series win over the Asian rivals.

Anti-rape bill: Trinamool, BJP put ball in each other's court for President nodSince criminal law comes under the Concurrent List, the legislation will require assent from the Bengal Governor and then the President.

Haryana student mistaken for cow smuggler, chased for 25 km, killedFive people, identified as cow vigilantes, were arrested on charges of killing a Class 12 student after mistaking him for a cattle smuggler in Faridabad.

Atlantic hurricanes have disappeared. Scientists don't know whySeveral theories have emerged to explain this unusual pattern. Some experts point to the massive submarine Hunga Tonga volcano eruption in 2022 as a potential disruptor.

Mumbai entrepreneur, 25, hospitalised after adopting 'hustle culture'. Full storyA Mumbai-based entrepreneur, Kritarth Mittal, was hospitalised after he adopted a relentless work schedule and a poor lifestyle.

25% IIT-Bombay graduates fail to secure placement, minimum pay drops to Rs 4 LPAThe 2024 placement season at IIT-Bombay concluded with an average annual package of Rs 23.5 lakh. Only 75 percent of students who actively participated in the campus drive secured jobs, with 1,475 job offers accepted. This marks a decline from last year's 82 percent placement rate.

Indian restaurants in UK in the grill for employing illegal immigrantsThe UK government is cracking down on businesses hiring illegal workers, with over 10 Indian-owned businesses, especially restaurants, fined. Rajpoot Indian Restaurant faced the highest penalty of £80,000. The crackdown is part of the UK's broader strategy to enforce immigration laws and reduce illegal immigration.

Pics: Kareena Kapoor, Ektaa Kapoor at 'The Buckingham Murders' trailer launchKareena Kapoor, Ektaa Kapoor along with filmmaker Hansal Mehta attended the trailer launch of their upcoming film 'The Buckingham Murders.' The film will release in theatres on September 13.

She finished in 7th position in the qualification round. Meanwhile, her compatriot Mona could not make it to the top 8.

Why is high blood pressure a silent killer?High blood pressure, often undetected, affects a significant portion of India's population, leading to severe health risks. Regular monitoring and lifestyle changes are essential to manage and prevent complications.

'Sixer King' Priyansh Arya calls Virat Kohli his favourite, wishes to play for RCBPriyansh Arya expressed his admiration towards Virat Kohli and called him his idol. He wished to play alongside him for RCB in IPL.

Victor Osimhen joins Galatasaray on 1-year loan deal after Napoli fallout Victor Osimhen's surprise loan to Galatasaray follows a fallout with Napoli and failed Chelsea transfer, signaling a likely permanent separation despite a lowered release clause and contract extension option until 2027.

Jos Butler in doubt for England vs Australia T20Is after calf-injuryJos Buttler's calf injury setback puts his participation in England's T20I series against Australia in doubt, specifically after re-aggravating the injury during his rehab. Sam Curran and Phil Salt emerge as potential stand-ins as the team remains hopeful for Buttler's recovery.

Nadal sides with Sinner amid doping row, says 'justice is justice'Rafael Nadal defended Jannik Sinner, expressing trust in the verdict clearing him of intentional doping. Despite controversy, Sinner's US Open run continues strong, with a Round of 16 clash against Tommy Paul on September 3.

India wins 8 medals on magical Monday at ParalympicsIt was a fine day for India at the Paris Paralympics on September 2, Monday as Sumit Antil and Nitesh Kumar claimed gold medals. India bagged a total of 8 medals on the day.

India's Nithya Sre Sivan bags bronze in badminton SH6 categoryParalympics 2024: Nithya Sri Sivan bagged the bronze medal in badminton in the SH6 category after beating Indonesia's Rina Marlina 21-14, 21-6.

Karolina Muchova knocks out Jasmine Paolini, Jessica Pegula in quartersUS Open 2024: Karolina Muchova made her way through to the quarterfinals after beating Jasmine Paolini. Jessica Pegula also secured a comprehensive win over Diana Shnaider.

Keep fighting for each point: How Nitesh Kumar overcame nemesis Bethell for goldIndia's Nitesh Kumar revealed how he was able to beat his nemesis Daniel Bethell to clinch the gold medal in the badminton men's singles SL3 final on September 2, Monday. Nitesh had never beaten Bethell until Monday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
